title-group.article-title: Convergence Rates of Approximate Least Squares Solutions of Linear Integral and Operator Equations of the First Kind

abstract.p: We consider approximations $\{x_n\}$ obtained by moment discretization to (i) the minimal $\mathscr{L}_2$-norm solution of $\mathscr{K}x = y$ where $\mathscr{K}$ is a Hilbert-Schmidt integral operator on $\mathscr{L}_2$, and to (ii) the least squares solution of minimal $\mathscr{L}_2$-norm of the same equation when $y$ is not in the range $\mathscr{R}(\mathscr{K})$ of $\mathscr{K}$. In case (i), if $y \in \mathscr{R}(\mathscr{K})$, then $x_n \rightarrow \mathscr{K}^\dagger y$, where $\mathscr{K}^\dagger$ is the generalized inverse of $\mathscr{K}$, and $\|x_n\| \rightarrow \infty$ otherwise. Rates of convergence are given in this case if further \mathscr{K}^\dagger y \in \mathscr{K}^\ast(\mathscr{L}_2)$, where $\mathscr{K}^\ast$ is the adjoint of $\mathscr{K}$, and the Hilbert-Schmidt kernel of $\mathscr{KK}^\ast$ satisfies certain smoothness conditions. In case (ii), if $y \in \mathscr{R}(\mathscr{K}) \bigoplus \mathscr{R}(\mathscr{K}^\perp$, then $x_n \rightarrow \mathscr{K}^\dagger y$, and $\|x_n\| \rightarrow \infty$ otherwise. If further $\mathscr{K}^\dagger y \im \mathscr{K}^\ast\mathscr{K}(\mathscr{L}_2)$, then rates of convergence are given in terms of the smoothness properties of the Hilbert-Schmidt kernel of $(\mathscr{KK}^\ast)^2$. Some of these results are generalized to a class of linear operator equations on abstract Hilbert spaces.
